009package Ch11_Circle_Ellipse_Fitting;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.ellipse.algebraic.EllipseFitAlgebraic.FitType.FitzgibbonStable;
012import static imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.ellipse.geometric.EllipseFitGeometric.FitType.DistanceBased;
013import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
014
015import java.util.Locale;
016
017import ij.IJ;
018import ij.ImagePlus;
019import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
020import ij.gui.Overlay;
021import ij.gui.Roi;
022import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
023import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
024import imagingbook.common.color.sets.BasicAwtColor;
025import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
026import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.AlgebraicEllipse;
027import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.GeometricEllipse;
028import imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.ellipse.algebraic.EllipseFitAlgebraic;
029import imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.ellipse.geometric.EllipseFitGeometric;
030import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
031import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
032import imagingbook.common.ij.RoiUtils;
033import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ColoredStroke;
034import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ShapeOverlayAdapter;
035
036/**
037 * <p>
038 * ImageJ plugin, performs algebraic ellipse fitting on the current ROI to find an initial ellipse, followed by
039 * geometric fitting. Algebraic and geometric fit methods can be selected (see Sec. 11.2 of [1] for details). If
040 * successful, the resulting ellipses are displayed as a vector overlay (color can be chosen). Sample points are either
041 * collected from the ROI (if available) or collected as foreground pixels (values &gt; 0) from the image. If no image
042 * is currently open, the user is asked to create a suitable sample image.
043 * </p>
044 * <p>
045 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
046 * (2022).
047 * </p>
048 *
049 * @author WB
050 * @version 2022/10/03
051 */
052public class Ellipse_Fitting implements PlugInFilter {
053        
054        static EllipseFitAlgebraic.FitType AlgebraicFitMethod = FitzgibbonStable;
055        static EllipseFitGeometric.FitType GeometricFitMethod = DistanceBased;
056        static boolean UsePointsFromRoi = false;
057        
058        private static BasicAwtColor AlgebraicFitColor = BasicAwtColor.Red;
059        private static BasicAwtColor GeometricFitColor = BasicAwtColor.Blue;
060        private static double StrokeWidth = 0.5;
061        
062        private ImagePlus im;
063        
064        /**
065         * Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image
066         * is currently open.
067         */
068        public Ellipse_Fitting() {
069                if (noCurrentImage()) {
070                        if (DialogUtils.askForSampleImage()) {
071                                IjUtils.run(new Ellipse_Make_Random()); //runPlugIn(Ellipse_Make_Random.class);
072                        }                       
073                }
074        }
075        
076        @Override
077        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
078                this.im = im;
079                return DOES_ALL;
080        }
081
082        @Override
083        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
084                Roi roi = im.getRoi();
085                UsePointsFromRoi = (roi != null);
086                
087                if (!runDialog()) {
088                        return;
089                }
090                
091                Pnt2d[] points = (UsePointsFromRoi) ?
092                                RoiUtils.getOutlinePointsFloat(roi) :
093                                IjUtils.collectNonzeroPoints(ip);
094                
095                IJ.log("Found points " + points.length);
096                if (points.length < 5) {
097                        IJ.error("At least 5 points are required, but found only " + points.length);
098                        return;
099                }
100                
101                Overlay oly = im.getOverlay();
102                if (oly == null) {
103                        oly = new Overlay();
104                        im.setOverlay(oly);
105                }
106                ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter(oly); 
107                
108                Pnt2d xref = Pnt2d.from(ip.getWidth()/2, ip.getHeight()/2);     // reference point for ellipse fitting
109                
110                // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
111                EllipseFitAlgebraic fitA = EllipseFitAlgebraic.getFit(AlgebraicFitMethod, points, xref);
112                // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
113                
114                AlgebraicEllipse ae = fitA.getEllipse();                
115                if (ae == null) {
116                        IJ.log("Algebraic fit: no result!");
117                        return;
118                }
119                
120                GeometricEllipse initEllipse = new GeometricEllipse(ae);
121                
122                IJ.log("Initial fit (algebraic):");
123                IJ.log("  ellipse: " + initEllipse.toString());
124                IJ.log(String.format(Locale.US, "  error = %.3f", initEllipse.getMeanSquareError(points)));
125                
126                ColoredStroke initialStroke = new ColoredStroke(StrokeWidth, AlgebraicFitColor.getColor());
127                ola.addShapes(initEllipse.getShapes(3), initialStroke);
128
129                // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
130                EllipseFitGeometric fitG = EllipseFitGeometric.getFit(GeometricFitMethod, points, initEllipse);
131                // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
132                
133                GeometricEllipse finalEllipse = fitG.getEllipse();
134                if (finalEllipse == null) {
135                        IJ.log("Geometric fit: no result!");
136                        return;
137                }
138                
139                IJ.log("Final fit (geometric):");
140                IJ.log("  ellipse: " + finalEllipse.toString());
141                IJ.log(String.format(Locale.US, "  error = %.3f", finalEllipse.getMeanSquareError(points)));
142                IJ.log("  iterations = " + fitG.getIterations());
143
144                ColoredStroke finalStroke = new ColoredStroke(StrokeWidth, GeometricFitColor.getColor());
145                ola.addShapes(finalEllipse.getShapes(3), finalStroke);
146        }
147
148        // ------------------------------------------
149        
150        private boolean runDialog() {
151                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
152                
153                gd.addMessage(DialogUtils.makeLineSeparatedString(
154                                "This plugin performs algebraic + geometric ellipse fitting,",
155                                "either to ROI points (if available) or foreground points",
156                                "collected from the pixel image."
157                                ));
158                
159                gd.addCheckbox("Use ROI (float) points", UsePointsFromRoi);
160                gd.addEnumChoice("Algebraic fit method", AlgebraicFitMethod);
161                gd.addEnumChoice("Algebraic ellipse color", AlgebraicFitColor);
162                gd.addEnumChoice("Geometric fit method", GeometricFitMethod);
163                gd.addEnumChoice("Geometric ellipse color", GeometricFitColor);
164                
165                gd.showDialog();
166                if (gd.wasCanceled())
167                        return false;
168                
169                AlgebraicFitMethod = gd.getNextEnumChoice(EllipseFitAlgebraic.FitType.class);
170                AlgebraicFitColor = gd.getNextEnumChoice(BasicAwtColor.class);
171                
172                GeometricFitMethod = gd.getNextEnumChoice(EllipseFitGeometric.FitType.class);
173                GeometricFitColor = gd.getNextEnumChoice(BasicAwtColor.class);
174                
175                return true;
176        }
177
178
179
180}
